EDUCATION AND TRAINING FOR HEALTH PROFESSIONALS. The Secretary will award grants to integrate training on eating disorders into existing curricula for healthcare professionals, including early intervention, treatment levels, referral procedures, prevention strategies, and treatment methods. Eligible entities can apply for these grants. Entities seeking grants under this section must submit an application to the Secretary, outlining their plan for fund usage and training evaluation. The funds awarded are to be used for developing evidence-based training programs on identifying, intervening in, preventing, and treating eating disorders through educational training and conferences. Promising practices and recommendations for identifying, intervening in, preventing, and treating eating disorders through educational training programs and conferences, including Internet-based courses and teleconferences. Topics covered include prevention strategies, early intervention, comprehensive assessment, and addressing related medical and mental health conditions. SEC. 7. EDUCATION AND TRAINING FOR SCHOOL AND HIGHER EDUCATION PROFESSIONALS. The Secretary will award grants to eligible entities for conducting educational seminars on early identification, intervention, and prevention of behaviors associated with eating disorders, as well as providing resources to individuals affected by eating disorders. Eligible entities must agree to conduct seminars considering educational materials from the BodyWise eating disorder initiative and relevant research. In this section, eligible entities such as states, territories, Indian tribes, and educational institutions can conduct educational seminars on eating disorders using materials from the BodyWise initiative and relevant research. SEC. 8. PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENTS. The Director of the National Institute of Mental Health will conduct public service announcements to educate the public on eating disorders, including types, seriousness, identification, prevention, discrimination, media effects, and signs/symptoms. Collaboration with centers of excellence is required. The Director of the National Institute of Mental Health will collaborate with centers of excellence and community-based national nonprofit resources to address eating disorders, body image, and weight issues. SEC. 9. CLARIFYING APPLICATION OF EXISTING PARITY LAW. Section 2726 of the Public Health Service Act is amended to address the treatment of permanent exclusions under mental health and substance use disorder benefits in group health plans or health insurance coverage. A plan or coverage offering such benefits cannot have a permanent exclusion for a specific condition or disorder.
